sponsor.partnerMessage: Baumann & Crosno Construction is committed to providing top-quality craftsmanship and personalized service to make your home-building experience seamless and enjoyable. Visit us at our open house at 116 Dobson Street, Pea Ridge, on May 7th from 2-4p to see our work firsthand.

posts.title: Things Are Looking Prehistoric At The Benton County Fairgrounds
posts.content:
The dino-themed family adventure Jurrasic Empire is coming to the Benton County Fairgrounds this weekend on May 6-7, transforming the space into a prehistoric landscape where kids can explore and play.

  • Through the ages: Featuring various fun and educational activities, the exhibit leads guests on a journey through the Jurassic and Ice Age periods highlighting the dinosaurs and mammals that ruled the earth more than 150m years ago.
  • Dino-ride: Kids of all ages can view over 50 life-size realistic dinosaurs in their natural habitat and even ride a 12-foot animatronic T Rex and Triceratops along with other hands-on interactions like a fossil dig, 9D virtual reality rides, and a Jurassic-themed bounce house.

Tickets are priced at $25 and can be found HERE.

posts.title: Enjoy Northwest Arkansas's Rivers With Some Spring Kayaking
posts.content:
The stunning rivers and waterways of Northwest Arkansas make the region a top destination for paddling enthusiasts looking to enjoy unparalleled scenery and adventure. Our friends from 37 North shared their favorite kayaking destinations around NWA to help get you out on the river!

  • Oars in the water: Winding through forests, valleys, and towering bluffs, the Kings River, Mulberry River, Illinois River, and Buffalo River are just a few of the many breathtaking rivers in the area, offering a range of experiences from gentle paddling to adrenaline-fueled whitewater.
  • Better with friends: If you're new to paddling and have an interest in renting equipment or joining a guided river experience, the guides at 37 North have extensive knowledge of local rivers and are Wilderness First Aid and CPR certified.

Take a look at our guide HERE, then get out paddling!

posts.title: Siloam Springs Kicks Off Farmers Market Season With A Disco
posts.content:
Main Street Siloam Springs will begin the 2023 Farmers Market season this Saturday, May 6, and what better way to get ready to shop local than a disco the night before?

  • Let's groove tonight: The 13th Annual Main Event, Downtown Disco, will begin Friday, May 5, at 5p at the Brick Ballroom on Broadway St., including dinner, drinks, auctions, and the Downtown Disco Dance-Off. Tickets are $45, and 70's attire is highly encouraged.
  • Waking up: Shop baked goods, locally raised meats, farm fresh produce, and artisan-produced items at Memorial Park during the first Siloam Springs Farmers Market of the year, kicking off at 8a and featuring live music with Jacob McCoy from 9-11a.

Find more events from Main Street Siloam Springs HERE.

posts.title: Nonprofits Join Hands To Form The Children And Family Advocacy Center
posts.topic: Sponsored by Children and Family Advocacy Center
posts.content:
Children‚Äôs Advocacy Center of Benton County and Restoration Village have combined to form the Children and Family Advocacy Center, unifying around one mission with one voice to more effectively restore lives impacted by trauma, break the cycle of abuse, and build resilient families.

  • On a mission: The dedicated trauma-informed professionals at the CFAC work diligently to empower those impacted by trauma by providing comprehensive services like advocacy, forensic interviewing, medical exams, and counseling.
  • Safe place: The Center also hosts training and education opportunities intended to break the cycle of abuse and offers residential housing for women and their children, providing food, housing, and transportation.

Follow their new socials @cfacbentonco and visit their new website HERE.

posts.title: Railyard Live Begins 2023 Season With Cinco De Mayo Fiesta
posts.content:
The 2023 Railyard Live concert season will kick off this weekend with a two-night Cinco de Mayo Fiesta featuring Proyecto Tumbado with DJ Susie Q on Friday, May 5, at 7p, followed by Rodney Block Collective with Pura Coco on Saturday, May 6, at 8p.

  • Weekend plans: Railyard Live takes place every Friday and Saturday night until the end of September, bringing a talented lineup of local and national acts to Butterfield Stage.
  • RSVP: General admission is free for lawn seating, but guests must reserve tickets to save their spot. Tables for four can be reserved for $30 per event.

Follow Railyard Live on social media for concert updates HERE.
